summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds averaged ~14.6 m/s (σ 1.74) with a brief peak to 39.1 m/s; power output stayed fairly steady at ~0.955 (σ 0.028) while rotor speed was nearly constant and generator speed showed modest variability. Notable operational patterns include a consistent negative power residual (mean −0.093) indicating underperformance versus expectation, an average blade pitch around 8.9°, a persistent ~11.9° offset between wind and turbine orientation, and elevated temperatures (~71.3°F), with no abnormal status entries recorded.
